page.title: 08FARMING BEULAH - GARTH
page.content: Small farms, average 150-200 acres. Mainly stock rearing; store and fat lambs and store cattle. Beulah Speckled Faced Sheep now a pedigree breed growing in popularity.Some Suffolk and Leicester sheep. Large markets at Builth in Autumn (up to 12,000 sheep in a day.) Store cattle, Freisian crossed with Charolais or Limousin bulls give heavy carcasses. Only one milk producing farm in block, with Freisian herd of 40-50.Machine milked, milk carried through pipes from cows to refrigated bulk tank. Daily collection by milk tanker for Llangadog Creamery, for sale as bottled milk or butter making. Hay made less nowadays, silage more suited to weather conditions, big bale silage latest method. Swedes grown also for feeding to animals.
